ratings.comment: Professor Jones seems really short via email, but in class is very outgoing and caring. Psych205 should be taken by any and all freshman psych majors--it allows you to meet professors, learn what they're studying, helps prepare you to be involved in research, and solidifies the love of psychology.

I recommend Psych 205 to every first-year psych major. This class is light on homework and super interesting. Each class a new researcher presents their work and it is legitimately interesting every week. She also has a lot of advice for class enrollment and teaches how to get involved in labs, research, service, etc. Super helpful.

This class was such a great experience to get me started off in the psych field.  Mostly online discussions, weekly field reports, placement evaluations, and 1 project proposal due at the end of the semester.  It'd be hard to not get an A.
Good teacher.  Received a 77% in the class a C.  A BC is a 78% and she wouldn't even talk to me about my grade at the end.  Good teacher but can seem stuck up

Class isn't too bad, but there is a lot of assigned reading that isn't covered in lecture but is on exams. One easy paper and lots of extra credit offered. You should't skip class because lecture slides aren't posted online and there is pop-up extra credit offered at times.

Melanie was very enthusiastic and lively during lectures.  She seems a little snarky at times but is very nice outside of class.  The 3 exams are tough but you'll do fine if you read the textbook and attend lecture.

Sometimes felt like we were being treated like kids (exam had questions from syllabus). But class was easy and interesting. Be sure to follow directions to a T, go to class or get notes (will offer ex. credit that can be missed), and read the book. Fairly easy to get a good grade once you know what she expects.

She works hard to make sure everyone in the class understands the material. First exam was a little nit-pickier than expected but the second two are predictable off of that. She's a little callous at first but warms up and is an overall good professor.

I loved Melanie. I went in for office hours for lots of help and she was very friendly and excited about the material. Attend lecture and read the book because she intermixes questions from both on the exam.

She was always friendly to me and answered emails promptly. Read all the assigned chapters as exams are mostly from the book. Even though lecture is kind of boring, you must go (or get notes) since she puts questions on the exam from them. Do all the extra credit since it's an easy 5 points. She rounds up grades in the end.

What an unpleasant person.  I went out of my way to put everything I had into this course and she proved to be absolutely no help.  Every time I approached her for help, she was either useless or simply rude.
Great professor--she's very friendly and excited in the material.  Gives opportunitites for extra credit and tried to keep class interesting with various videos.
I loved Melanie. She's very nice and excited about psychology. Take her if you can!
The most interesting class I've taken so far! Melanie is a great teacher who keeps students entertained while teaching. Loved it!

Recommend this class, probably the easiest psych class ive taken.  3 exams, 50 questions each, be sure to read the book, there will be things not covered in class on the test.  One "child observation" assignment, one quiz and lots of opportunities for extra credit.
I liked the material, but Melanie was a bad prof for the class. She didn't seem interested in the material & lectures were practically useless. To succeed you MUST read & study the textbook.

Okay class.  Material was interesting, class not so much.  I'm sure I could have gotten a better grade if I studied more out of the book, notes don't help that much on the exams.  Overall I would take the class again, maybe with a different professor.

Melanie is a friendly and fun person.  She tells pretty good stories in class.  If you read the book you will do well.  also, if you miss class be sure to get the notes because she will throw in a question from lecture.  however, you will find that her lectures basically repeat what the book says and that she does not try to trick you on exams.

This class was actually a little difficult.  Jones goes really fast during class so it's sometimes hard to get down everything she's saying.  Attendance and reading the textbook are a must.  Pretty nice lady and usually answers questions but sometimes she can seem a little rude.  Good class though.
